trans-unit.source: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions
trans-unit.target: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions
trans-unit.target: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions

trans-unit.source: API Management supports multi-region deployment which enables API publishers to distribute a single API management service across any number of desired Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: API Management supports multi-region deployment which enables API publishers to distribute a single API management service across any number of desired Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: This helps reduce request latency perceived by geographically distributed API consumers and also improves service availability if one region goes offline.
trans-unit.target: This helps reduce request latency perceived by geographically distributed API consumers and also improves service availability if one region goes offline.

trans-unit.source: When an API Management service is created initially, it contains only one <link><linkText>unit[]</linkText><title></title></link> and resides in a single Azure region, which is designated as the Primary Region.
trans-unit.target: When an API Management service is created initially, it contains only one <link><linkText>unit[]</linkText><title></title></link> and resides in a single Azure region, which is designated as the Primary Region.

trans-unit.source: Additional regions can be easily added through Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Additional regions can be easily added through Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: API Management proxy server is deployed to each region and call traffic will be routed to the closest proxy.
trans-unit.target: API Management proxy server is deployed to each region and call traffic will be routed to the closest proxy.

trans-unit.source: When a region goes offline, the traffic is automatically re-directed to the next closest proxy.
trans-unit.target: When a region goes offline, the traffic is automatically re-directed to the next closest proxy.

trans-unit.source: Multi-region deployment is only available in the **<link><linkText>Premium[]</linkText><title></title></link>** tier.
trans-unit.target: Multi-region deployment is only available in the **<link><linkText>Premium[]</linkText><title></title></link>** tier.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Deploy an API Management service instance to a new region
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Deploy an API Management service instance to a new region

trans-unit.source: To get started, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Scale tab in Azure Portal for your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Scale tab in Azure Portal for your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To deploy to a new region, click on the drop-down list below the primary region and pick a region from the list.
trans-unit.target: To deploy to a new region, click on the drop-down list below the primary region and pick a region from the list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add region</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add region</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the region is selected, pick the number of units for the new region from the unit drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Once the region is selected, pick the number of units for the new region from the unit drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Specify units</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Specify units</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the desired regions and units are configured, click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired regions and units are configured, click Save.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Delete an API Management service instance from a region
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Delete an API Management service instance from a region

trans-unit.source: To remove an API Management service instance from a region, navigate to the Scale tab in Azure Portal for your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: To remove an API Management service instance from a region, navigate to the Scale tab in Azure Portal for your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the X to the right of the desired region to remove.
trans-unit.target: Click the X to the right of the desired region to remove.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Remove region</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Remove region</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the desired regions are removed, click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired regions are removed, click Save.
